plugin.summary: Checks the version of the SSH Server

attributes.attribute: The remote SSH server is affected by a denial of service vulnerability.

** DISPUTED ** The kex_input_kexinit function in kex.c in OpenSSH 6.x and 7.x through 7.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by sending many duplicate KEXINIT requests. NOTE: a third party reports that 'OpenSSH upstream does not consider this as a security issue.'

Upgrade to the latest version of the SSH server software. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in source code fix, available at: http://cvsweb.openbsd.org/cgi-bin/cvsweb/src/usr.bin/ssh/kex.c#rev1.127.
true
CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks if ASF / RMCP protocol is running on remot host

attributes.attribute: The remote host is running ASF / RMCP protocol.

Alert Standard Format (ASF) is a standard for remote monitoring, management and control of computer systems in both OS-present and OS-absent environments.
Remote Management and Control Protocol (RMCP) is a network protocol using for remote control of ASF-aware host.
This finding is informational, no action is required.
false

plugin.summary: Checks which cipher suites are supported by IPMI interface.

attributes.attribute: The remote host is running IPMI interface, which supports some cipher suites.
IPMI interface could supports some cipher suites using for providing the authentication, integrity, and confidentiality between IPMI device and client.
This finding is informational, no action is required.
false

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

[CVE-2020-26935] An issue was discovered in SearchController in phpMyAdmin before 4.9.6 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A SQL injection vulnerability was discovered in how phpMyAdmin processes SQL statements in the search feature. An attacker could use this flaw to inject malicious SQL in to a query. [CVE-2020-26934] phpMyAdmin before 4.9.6 and 5.x before 5.0.3 allows XSS through the transformation feature via a crafted link.
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for these issues in versions 4.9.6 and 5.0.3.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by an authentication bypass vulnerability.

An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin 4.9 before 4.9.8 and 5.1 before 5.1.2. A valid user who is already authenticated to phpMyAdmin can manipulate their account to bypass two-factor authentication for future login instances.
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in versions 4.9.8 and 5.1.2.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by a SQL injection vulnerability.

In phpMyAdmin 4 before 4.9.4 and 5 before 5.0.1, SQL injection exists in the user accounts page. A malicious user could inject custom SQL in place of their own username when creating queries to this page. An attacker must have a valid MySQL account to access the server.
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in versions 4.9.4 and 5.0.1.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
In phpMyAdmin before 4.9.11 and 5.x before 5.2.1, an authenticated user can trigger XSS by uploading a crafted .sql file through the drag-and-drop interface.
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in versions 4.9.11 and 5.1.2.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

plugin.summary: Checks for the Apache web server version and whether ssl/mod_ssl is used

attributes.attribute: The remote web server, when used along with OpenSSL 1.1.1 or later, is affected by a denial of service vulnerability.

A bug exists in the way mod_ssl handled client renegotiations. A remote attacker could send a carefully crafted request that would cause mod_ssl to enter a loop leading to a denial of service. This bug can be only triggered with Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.37 when using OpenSSL version 1.1.1 or later, due to an interaction in changes to handling of renegotiation attempts.
It is strongly recommended to upgrade the Apache server to the latest stable version. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in version 2.4.38.
true
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

[CVE-2019-18622] An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.9.2. A crafted database/table name can be used to trigger a SQL injection attack through the designer feature.
[CVE-2019-19617] phpMyAdmin before 4.9.2 does not escape certain Git information, related to libraries/classes/Display/GitRevision.php and libraries/classes/Footer.php.
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for this issue in version 4.9.2.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks for version of phpMyAdmin module in web server

attributes.attribute: The remote phpMyAdmin is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

[CVE-2020-10802] In phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.9.5 and 5.x before 5.0.2, a SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered where certain parameters are not properly escaped when generating certain queries for search actions in libraries/classes/Controllers/Table/TableSearchController.php. An attacker can generate a crafted database or table name. The attack can be performed if a user attempts certain search operations on the malicious database or table. [CVE-2020-10803] In phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.9.5 and 5.x before 5.0.2, a SQL injection vulnerability was discovered where malicious code could be used to trigger an XSS attack through retrieving and displaying results (in tbl_get_field.php and libraries/classes/Display/Results.php). The attacker must be able to insert crafted data into certain database tables, which when retrieved (for instance, through the Browse tab) can trigger the XSS attack. [CVE-2020-10804] In phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.9.5 and 5.x before 5.0.2, a SQL injection vulnerability was found in retrieval of the current username (in libraries/classes/Server/Privileges.php and libraries/classes/UserPassword.php). A malicious user with access to the server could create a crafted username, and then trick the victim into performing specific actions with that user account (such as editing its privileges).
Upgrade to the latest version of the phpMyAdmin. The vendor has prepared a fix for these issues in versions 4.9.5 and 5.0.2.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

plugin.summary: Checks if SMTP server supports DSN (Delivery Status Notification).

attributes.attribute: Checks if SMTP server supports DSN (Delivery Status Notification).

The remote mail server supports DSN ESMTP extension, as specified by RFC 3461. An attacker can use it to force delivery status reports generation even upon successful mail delivery. This behaviour may be abused to obtain information about internal infrastructure or attack (mail bombing) third party addresses even on servers properly secured from backscatter on mail delivery failure.
Disable DSN support for inbound mail. For Postfix mail server see `DSN_README' file in Postfix documentation.
true
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N

plugin.summary: Processes previously added KB items.

attributes.attribute: An SMTP Mail server is running on the remote host.
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an Internet standard for electronic mail (e-mail) transmission across IP networks
This finding is informational, no action is required.
false

plugin.summary: Checks for SMTP open relay

attributes.attribute: The remote SMTP server is explicitly configured to allow SMTP mail relay, which allows abuse by spammers.

The remote SMTP server is configured in such a way that it allows spammers and worms to send e-mail through it, not just mail destined to or originating from known users. Successful exploitation will allow attackers to send email messages outside of the served network. This could result in unauthorized messages being sent from the vulnerable server.
Modify the SMTP server configuration to disable open relaying.
false
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
